title: Two Charged in Louvre Crown Jewels Theft, Total Charged Now Four
snippets: A man and a woman, both in their late 30s, were charged with organized crime and being an accomplice, respectively. In total, four people have been charged in connection to the brazen theft.
Two more charged in connection with Louvre jewel heist Reuters
A 38-year-old woman and a man, 37, appeared before a French magistrate over the museum theft that shocked the world.
Both suspects, who were arrested earlier this week, have denied involvement.
Paris police have so far arrested seven people in connection with last month's theft of crown jewels; three of them have been released.

Woman, 38, and man, 37, had been arrested on Wednesday in relation to theft of £76m worth of jewellery in Paris Two more suspects, a man and a woman arrested this week over the jewel heist at the Louvre, have been charged and remanded in custody, prosecutors have said. The charges on Saturday brough
Two more suspects have been charged for their alleged involvement in last month’s daytime heist at the Louvre,
In addition to the two main suspects, who partially admitted to the robbery, two others have been charged by the Paris prosecutor overseeing the case.
The Paris prosecutor said Saturday two new suspects were handed preliminary charges for their alleged involvement in the crown jewels heist at the Louvre museum.
The Paris prosecutor said Saturday two new suspects were handed preliminary charges for their alleged involvement in the crown jewels heist at the Louvre Museum in October.

PARIS (AP) — The Paris prosecutor said Saturday two new suspects were handed preliminary charges for their alleged involvement in the crown jewels heist at the Louvre museum, three days after they were arrested by police as part of the sweeping investigation. titles: 2 more suspects are charged in the Louvre jewel heist

summary: Two more individuals, a 38-year-old woman and a 37-year-old man, have been charged in connection with a high-profile theft of crown jewels from the Louvre Museum in Paris. They face charges of organized crime and being an accomplice, respectively, and have been remanded in custody. This brings the total to four people charged over the heist, with seven arrests made in total by Paris police, though three have been released. Both of the recently charged suspects have denied their involvement in the theft.

title: Trump Threatens Military Action Against Nigeria Over Christian Violence
snippets: Trump threatens US military action in Nigeria over treatment of Christians Reuters
Trump threatens Nigeria with potential military action, escalates claim of Christian persecution AP News
Nigerian government denies US president's claim of not stemming 'horrible atrocities' against Christians.
President Donald Trump said he has instructed the Pentagon to prepare for possible action in Nigeria, if the government "continues to allow the killing of Christians."

US president says he ordered Pentagon to begin planning for action, without mentioning Muslim persecution Donald Trump on Saturday said he had ordered the Pentagon to begin planning for potential military action in Nigeria as he stepped up his criticism that the government was failing to rein in the
The move is an escalation in the president’s campaign against the West African country’s government over allegedly failing to protect Christians.
Accusing Nigeria of not doing enough to protect Christians from violence, President Trump said he had ordered the Pentagon to prepare for action.

summary: President Donald Trump has threatened military action against Nigeria, accusing its government of failing to prevent violence against Christians. He stated that he has directed the Pentagon to plan for potential intervention. This marks an escalation in his criticism of Nigeria's handling of religious persecution. The Nigerian government has denied these accusations, asserting that it does not condone violence against Christians.

title: Tanzania's President Wins Re-election Amid Protests and Vote Integrity Concerns
snippets: President Samia Suluhu Hassan won the country's disputed election with more than 97% of the vote, according to official results announced Saturday, in a rare landslide victory in the region.
Tanzania's President has been declared the winner of the country’s presidential elections amid deadly unrest.
Tanzania president wins election landslide after deadly protests Al Arabiya English
Rights groups warned of growing violence against demonstrators after the election in which the country’s president barred her two main opponents from running.
Election monitors and members of the European Parliament have questioned the election’s integrity, and violent protests have rocked the country.

Tanzanian President Samia Suluhu Hassan was declared on Saturday the landslide winner of an election that set off deadly protests across the country this week over the exclusion of her main challengers.
Tanzania's Hassan declared landslide winner in election marred by violence Reuters

The result hands Hassan, who took power in 2021, a five-year term following opposition repression Tanzania’s president, Samia Suluhu Hassan, has been declared the winner of the country’s disputed election with more than 97% of the vote following violent protests across the country earlier in the wee
titles: Tanzanian president wins disputed election with more than 97% of the vote

summary: Tanzania's President Samia Suluhu Hassan was declared the winner of the country's presidential election with over 97% of the vote, amid violent protests and criticism over the election's integrity. The election saw deadly unrest and the barring of her main opponents. Rights groups and international observers have raised concerns about violence against demonstrators and the fairness of the process. Hassan's victory secures her a five-year term, following an election marred by controversy and opposition repression.

title: Carney Apologizes to Trump Over Ad, Trade Talks Halted
snippets: Canada's Carney says he apologised to Trump over Reagan ad Reuters
Canadian PM says anti-tariff ad featuring Ronald Reagan 'offended' Trump, who has since cut off trade talks with Canada.
Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney said he disagreed with the airing of an anti-tariffs ad featuring Republican icon Ronald Reagan that exacerbated tensions with the US government.
The US president cancelled trade talks and raised levies over the television campaign launched by Ontario
President Donald Trump halted trade talks with Canada over the ad, which was paid for by the Ontario government and featured Ronald Reagan criticizing tariffs.
The Canadian prime minister also said that he had asked the province of Ontario not to air the ad that later prompted the president to end trade talks.

GYEONGJU — Prime Minister Mark Carney says he told Ontario Premier Doug Ford that he didn’t think the province should run the ad campaign that’s being blamed for ending trade talks with the U.S. When asked on Saturday what Ford’s response to that was, Carney said, “Well, you saw what came of it.” Th

summary: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney apologized to President Donald Trump for an anti-tariff ad featuring Ronald Reagan, which led to Trump halting trade talks with Canada. The ad, funded by the Ontario government, offended Trump, prompting increased tariffs and the cancellation of trade discussions. Carney expressed disagreement with the ad's airing and communicated his concerns to Ontario Premier Doug Ford, but the campaign proceeded, resulting in the cessation of trade negotiations between the U.S. and Canada.

title: Serbia Marks 1st Anniversary of Deadly Train Collapse with Mass Protests
snippets: Tens of thousands protest in Serbia on anniversary of deadly roof collapse Reuters
Tens of thousands of people marked the first anniversary of a train station roof collapse in silence.
Large crowds converge in Novi Sad to commemorate deadly accident that has led to frequent mass antigovernment protests.

Protesters arrived in Serbia's second city to mark the first anniversary of the roof collapse that killed 16. The government hastily declared a day of mourning while President Vucic issued a rare apology.

Student-led movement continues to demand political change as embattled president issues rare apology Tens of thousands of Serbians have gathered to commemorate victims of a fatal railway station collapse a year ago, a tragedy that galvanised anti-government sentiment that still threatens the embattl

summary: Tens of thousands of people gathered in Novi Sad, Serbia, to mark the first anniversary of a train station roof collapse that killed 16 individuals. The event has sparked frequent mass antigovernment protests, leading to a day of mourning declared by the government and a rare apology from President Vucic. The tragedy has also fueled a student-led movement demanding political change in Serbia.

title: China Stops Export Controls on Rare Earths, Ends US Chip Firm Probes
snippets: China to End Rare Earth Controls, Probes Against Chip Companies Bloomberg.com
China will issue export licenses for rare earths, gallium, germanium, antimony and graphite “for the benefit of U.S. end users and their suppliers,” the White House said.

China will effectively suspend implementation of additional export controls on rare earth metals and terminate investigations targeting US companies in the semiconductor supply chain, the White House announced.
titles: China to End Rare Earth Controls, Probes Against Chip Companies - Bloomberg.com
China to suspend some rare earth curbs, probes on U.S. chip firms

summary: China has decided to halt additional export controls on rare earth metals and end investigations into US semiconductor companies. The White House stated that China will also issue export licenses for rare earths and other materials to support US end users and their suppliers.

title: Nationwide Queues at Food Pantries After SNAP Benefits End

(AP) — People across the country formed long lines for free meals and groceries at food pantries and drive-through giveaways Saturday, after monthly benefits through the federal Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program, or SNAP, were suddenly cut off because of the ongoing governmen

title: Landslide in Western Kenya Kills 13, 30 Missing Amid Heavy Rains
snippets: Landslide kills at least 13 in western Kenya Reuters

Heavy rains inundated the Marakwet East constituency, damaging the road network. The interior minister said at least 30 more were still missing, as authorities suspended the search operation for the day.
Kenya's government says 30 other people are missing following downpours in the west of the country.
titles: Landslide kills at least 13 in western Kenya - Reuters

summary: A landslide triggered by heavy rains in Marakwet East, western Kenya, resulted in at least 13 deaths. The interior minister reported that 30 individuals are still missing, and the search operation has been temporarily suspended. The downpour also caused significant damage to the area's road network.

title: Arch Manning Leads Texas to Victory Over Vanderbilt After Concussion Recovery
snippets: Manning's lone blemish of the week came when he was behind the wheel of his car

Texas quarterback Arch Manning returned from a concussion a week earlier to pass for 328 yards and three touchdowns, including a 75-yard connection with Ryan Wingo on the first play of the game, to lead the No. 20 Longhorns over No. 9 Vanderbilt 34-31 on Saturday.
titles: Arch Manning explains viral traffic stop after leading No. 20 Texas past No. 9 Vanderbilt

summary: Texas quarterback Arch Manning, after recovering from a concussion, led the No. 20 Longhorns to a 34-31 victory over No. 9 Vanderbilt by passing for 328 yards and three touchdowns. This performance included a 75-yard touchdown pass to Ryan Wingo on the game's first play. Manning's only issue of the week occurred while driving his car, but it did not impact his game performance.
